Question: About Can Tho, Vietnam
Answer: Nestled in the verdant embrace of the Mekong Delta, Can Tho beckons travelers with a symphony of sights, sounds, and flavors that epitomize the essence of Vietnam. This enchanting city is a gateway to the region's rich cultural heritage and timeless traditions. The iconic floating market stands as a testament to the city's vibrant trading history, where boats laden with fresh fruits, vegetables, and handicrafts create a lively tapestry on the water. Beyond the market's bustling energy, Can Tho offers a serene escape into the countryside, where emerald rice paddies, charming villages, and ancient pagodas await exploration. From savoring the nuances of local cuisine to traversing the intricate network of canals, every moment in Can Tho unfolds as a captivating chapter in the story of Vietnam's captivating soul.

Question: How is Can Tho's weather? The best time to visit Can Tho
Answer:
Can Tho is typical of a tropical climate with 2 seasons: the dry season from December to April and the wet season from May to November. With an average temperature of 28°C, the weather is warm and humid during the year. The city has a unique beauty in every season, thus visitors can travel to Can Tho at any time during the year.

The season of fruit ripening: Fruit is mostly ripe from June to August. If you travel to Can Tho during this time, you will have an opportunity to enjoy many kinds of ripe fruits right at the garden.
The season of flooding water: The flooding season is from September to November. Water floods the rice paddy fields and weaves through canals and rivers, drawing a beautiful scenery. This is also the best time to visit Can Tho and the Southwest of Vietnam. 
The season of flowers: The period from December to January marks the coming of the Lunar New Year. Hence, Can Tho is overwhelmed with many brilliant colors of flowers during this time.

Question: Must-visit tourist attractions in Can Tho, Vietnam
Answer:
Cai Rang Floating Market
Location: downstream of Can Tho River, 46 Hai Ba Trung, Ninh Kieu District, Can Tho, Vietnam

With a history of almost 100 years, Cai Rang Floating Market is one of the oldest cultural spots in the Mekong Delta region. It is also the most famous and largest floating market in Vietnam and the only Southeast Asian representative featuring in the world’s 19 must-visit food hubs.
The market is only open in the early morning from 5 – 9 a.m. Hundreds of traders in their boats gather to buy fresh vegetables and fruits, breakfast, handicrafts and daily essential household goods, creating a bustling and joyful atmosphere. If you want to see the market, you can rent a sightseeing boat which costs around 300,000 – 500,000 VND.
Phong Dien Floating Market
Location: Provincial Road 923, Nhon Loc Hamlet, Nhon Ai Commune, Phong Dien District, Can Tho City
Situated at a confluence and 17 kilometers away from the center of Can Tho City, Phong Dien Floating Market is a smaller and more local-style market. The market is most crowded from 5.30 – 7.30 a.m and offers a variety of fresh fruits, vegetables, household goods, working equipment, etc. When you come to this market, don’t forget to try many delicious local dishes being sold right on the boats such as noodle soup, rice soup and coffee.
Ninh Kieu Wharf
Location: Hai Ba Trung Street, Tan An Ward, Ninh Kieu District, Can Tho City
Located on the right bank of Hau River, at the confluence of Hau River and Can Tho River, Ninh Kieu Wharf is a tourist attraction and a symbol of Can Tho City. Established in the 19th century, it has long been developed into Ninh Kieu Park with an area of 7000 square meters.Inside the park, trees are trimmed carefully and green grass grows under the white bricks. Sitting in the park, you can enjoy the pure air and fresh breeze that bring a sense of refreshment. The park is even more stunning and charming at night because of the lighting system.

3.4. Fruit Garden
The land of Can Tho is bestowed with fertile soil, making it suitable for local people to plant and grow fruit gardens during the year. If you visit Can Tho Bridge
Can Tho Bridge is the longest cable-stayed bridge in Southeast Asia and one of the ten longest bridges in the world. Crossing Hau River and connecting Can Tho and Vinh Long Province, the bridge is 15,850 meters long and 23 meters wide.

Can Tho Vietnam
Can Tho Bridge is the longest cable-stayed bridge in Southeast Asia (Source: Collected)
The bridge is designed with an inverted Y-shaped pillar structure containing 216 strands of cables. If you look at the bridge from afar, it has a tranquil and romantic beauty, and it is even more shimmering at night when the lighting system runs the length of the bridge.

Can Tho Vietnam
A romantic beauty of Can Tho Bridge (Source: Collected) 
3.6. Bang Lang Stork Sanctuary
Location: Thoi An, Thuan An Ward, Thot Not District, Can Tho City
Situated 60 kilometers away from the city center, Bang Lang Stork Sanctuary is a destination where you can contemplate the diversity of birds. The sanctuary is home to 20 different species of storks and a total of 300,000 storks. It has an area of 16,500 square meters, serving tourism needs and protecting biodiversity.

Can Tho Vietnam
Bang Lang Stork Sanctuary is home to 20 species of storks (Source: Collected)
3.7. Binh Thuy Ancient House
Location: 144 Bui Huu Nghia Street, Binh Thuy Ward, Binh Thuy District, Can Tho City
Built in 1870, Binh Thuy Ancient House is one of the most beautiful old houses in the Mekong Delta region. With modern French architecture, the house is a harmonious combination of Eastern and Western culture, creating a classical and traditional beauty.

Can Tho Vietnam
Binh Thuy Ancient House has an impressive architecture (Source: Collected)
The highlight of Binh Thuy Ancient House is the collection of artifacts that have been preserved for generations such as the Louis 15 French-style woven cloth, the 15th century white lanterns, the teacups from the Ming-Thanh dynasty, etc. Due to its unique architecture and historical value, it was designated as a National Architectural and artistic monument in 2009.

Can Tho Vietnam
The ancient house preserves a valuable artifact collection (Source: Collected)

Binh Thuy ancient house: A national heritage site for architect arts
3.8. Ong Pagoda
Location: 32 Hai Ba Trung, Tan An Ward, Ninh Kieu District, Can Tho City
Ong Pagoda, which was built in 1894, was originally called Quang Trieu Hoi Quan. With a history of over 120 years, the pagoda still preserves the beauty of its colorful Chinese-style architecture. Its structure resembles the letter “Quoc”, while the exterior is painted with sophisticated decorations. As a famous spiritual site, Ong Pagoda was recognized as a National Historic – Cultural Heritage Site in 1993.

Can Tho Vietnam
Ong Pagoda highlights Chinese-style architecture (Source: Collected)
3.9. My Khanh Tourist Village
Location: 335 Lo Vong Cung, Nhon My Hamlet, My Khanh Commune, Phong Dien District, Can Tho City
With an area of over 50,000 square meters, My Khanh Tourist Village is home to an orchard with more than 20 species of plants, many fish ponds and canals. Besides, a prominent feature of the village is the 100-year-old ancient houses with traditional Vietnamese-style architecture. Visiting this place, visitors can savor many local specialties, watch Don Ca Tai Tu performances and animal races or taste fresh fruits.

Can Tho Vietnam
Watch a dog race at My Khanh Tourist Village (Source: Collected)

4. What to eat in Can Tho, Vietnam?
Traveling to Can Tho, you should not miss out on many delicious local specialties. Below are some famous dishes suggested for you.

Phong Dien Fine Rice Vermicelli (Banh hoi Phong Dien)
Phong Dien Fine Rice Vermicelli consists of rice vermicelli woven into intricate bundles, topped with chopped scallions and wrapped with grilled pork and fresh vegetables. The flavor of the dish is even more excellent when you dip the wrap in fish sauce. Coming to Can Tho, you should try this dish at Ut Dzach Fine Rice Vermicelli, 509 Provincial Road 61B, Nhon Binh Hamlet, Nhon Ai Commune, Phong Dien District at a price of 20,000 – 50,000 VND.

Can Tho Vietnam
Phong Dien Fine Rice Vermicelli - a must-try local dish (Source: Collected)
Fish sauce hot pot
Fish sauce hot pot is a unique dish in the Southwest of Vietnam with more than 40 kinds of vegetables, fresh seafood and meat as ingredients. The sauce is made from fish sauce, creating a rich and alluring flavor. Traveling to Can Tho, you can enjoy this dish at Da Ly Fish Sauce Hot Pot, 89 3/2 Street, Ninh Kieu District. The price is around 100,000 – 220,000 VND.

Can Tho Vietnam
Fish sauce hot pot is a typical dish of Can Tho (Source: Collected)
Can Tho pancake
Inside the golden crispy and greasy crust is full of meat and shrimps. The pancake will be wrapped with raw vegetables and dipped in fish sauce, creating an unforgettable flavor for visitors. Muoi Xiem Pancake at 13/3 Nguyen Chi Thanh Street, Tra Noc Ward, Binh Thuy is a recommended shop for you with the price varying from 40,000 – 150,000 VND.

Can Tho Vietnam
Can Tho pancake has an unforgettable flavor (Source: Collected)
Grilled Snakehead Fish
The cook will use a skewer to spear the fish’s mouth, then stick it in the ground, cover it with straw and burn it until the straw is burned out. When the fish is well done, it is put on a banana leaf and has all the burnt parts removed. You will enjoy the fish with onion fat, peanuts, rice paper, fresh vegetables and fish sauce. Coc Son, a tourist destination, is famous for its delicious grilled snakehead fish, thus you can come and try this dish there.

Can Tho Vietnam
Grilled snakehead fish has a rich flavor (Source: Collected)
Fried Shrimp Cake
A fried shrimp cake is made by putting pork, shrimp and green peas in a crispy crust. The cake tastes better when you enjoy it with fresh vegetables and sweet fish sauce. Co Ut Fried Shrimp Cake, 86/38 Ly Tu Trong Street, An Cu Ward, Ninh Kieu District is a shop suggested for you. The price is around 10,000 – 30,000 VND.

Can Tho Vietnam
A fried shrimp cake has a crispy and greasy crust (Source: Collected)
Can Tho during the season of fruit ripening, you can enjoy many fresh fruits right at the orchards. Below are some popular orchards recommended for you.

Phong Dien Orchard: Phong Dien District, Can Tho City
My Khanh Orchard: 335 Lo Vong Cung, My Khanh Commune, Phong Dien District, Can Tho City
Rach Ke Orchard: 396A My Nhon, My Khanh Commune, Phong Dien District, Can Tho City

Question: How to get to Can Tho City, Vietnam?
Answer:
As an important industrial center of the Mekong Delta region, Can Tho, Vietnam has a convenient system of transportation. Depending on your departure location, you can choose to travel to Can Tho by the following means of transportation:

From Hanoi to Can Tho
Traveling by airplane is the best way to save time, since many of Vietnam's major airlines such as Vietnam Airlines, Vietjet or Bamboo Airways have direct flights from Hanoi to Can Tho. The airplane ticket price varies from 800,000 – 2,500,000 VND/person depending on your seat class and the airline. You should book the ticket as soon as possible to get a low price.

If you want to travel by train, it takes 30 hours to go from Hanoi to Ho Chi Minh City, then you have to catch a bus from Ho Chi Minh City to Can Tho. Another option is traveling by express bus from Hanoi to Can Tho which costs around 800,000 – 1,000,000 VND/person, but it takes a lot of time.

 From Ho Chi Minh city to Can Tho
It takes an average of 3-4 hours to travel by express bus from Ho Chi Minh City to Can Tho. You can buy a ticket at Mien Dong Bus Station which costs around 130,000 – 150,000 VND/person. Mai Linh, Hoang Long, Phuong Trang are some prestigious express buses recommended for you.

Can Tho is 165 kilometers away from Ho Chi Minh City, thus tourists can choose to travel by motorbike or private car. It takes 3.5 – 4 hours to travel from Ho Chi Minh City to Can Tho, and you must check the route carefully before traveling.

Question: Where to stay in Can Tho City?
Answer: Depending on preferences and budgets, visitors can choose to stay in a hotel, homestay or resort. When choosing, think about whether the accommodation has a favorable geographical position, making it convenient for you to get to many famous destinations such as Ninh Kieu Wharf, Ong Pagoda, Binh Thuy Ancient House, Cai Rang Floating Market, etc. Your chosen accommodation should also have diverse facilities, such as an outdoor swimming pool, a bar, yoga, gym, massage and treatment services, etc. Built-in restaurants serving local specialties such as pancake, fish sauce hot pot, etc., are also good to have.

Question: What to buy as gifts for family and friends in Can Tho, Vietnam?
Answer:
There are many unique and cheap specialties which are suitable to be bought as gifts for families and friends in Can Tho. You can refer to the following list:

Fresh fruits
As Can Tho is well-known for a large number of lush orchards, fresh fruit is an ideal and healthy gift that anyone will love. You can buy fresh fruits in some floating markets and orchards, especially Phong Dien Orchard which is famous for its Ha Chau strawberries.
Muoi Cuong Cocoa
Muoi Cuong Cocoa is not only a tourist destination but also the name of a famous local cocoa brand. Visitors can buy cocoa as gifts for families and friends or enjoy cocoa right at the garden. It is in My Ai Hamlet, My Khanh Commune. Phong Dien District, Can Tho Province.
Sau Tia plum wine
It is called Sau Tia plum wine because after visiting his garden, a man called Mr. Sau felt that the aroma of the wine smelled like that of ripe plums. The wine is made manually without alcohol or chemicals, thus it is good for health and has a rich flavor. You can buy the wine at Mr. Sau’s house at Tan Loc Street, Tan Loc Ward, Thot Not District.

Can Tho Vietnam
Sau Tia plum wine is popular in the West of Vietnam (Source: Collected)
Banh tet la cam – Can Tho’s special cylindric glutinous rice cake
Unlike other cylindric glutinous rice cakes, Can Tho’s cylindric glutinous rice cake has a purple color instead of green. The fillings are usually beans, bananas, sausages, meat and salted eggs. You can find this local gift at Binh Thuy Market, An Nghiep Market, Can Tho Market, etc.

Can Tho Vietnam
Banh tet la cam - Can Tho’s special cylindric glutinous rice cake
Thuan Hung rice paper
Thuan Hung rice paper has a unique flavor that could not be found anywhere else. The rice paper is made from the rice flour in Thot Not region which has a fragrant aroma and soft texture. There are 4 types of Thuan Hung rice paper: spring rolls, coconut cakes, savory cakes and flat cakes.

Can Tho Vietnam
The rice paper is being dried out (Source: Collected)
Can Tho, Vietnam is a magnificent and peaceful destination with white rice paddy fields, floating markets, orchards and a system of rivers and canals. Visiting this land, visitors will have an opportunity to discover the culture and history and learn more about the daily life of local people.

Question: new landmark for Can Tho City, the Mekong Delta Tower.
Answer:
magine a new landmark for Can Tho City, the Mekong Delta Tower. Designed to reflect the flowing waters and vibrant culture of the Mekong Delta, this modern marvel would stand tall at 350 meters, making it a standout feature in the cityscape. Its structure would mimic the sinuous curves of a river, crafted from glass and steel that shimmer like the surface of the water under the sun.

The Mekong Delta Tower would feature multiple levels accessible by both stairs and panoramic elevators. The lower levels would host a variety of local markets and cultural spaces, representing the rich heritage of Can Tho, while the middle levels would house exquisite restaurants and cafes offering traditional Vietnamese cuisine with a modern twist.

At the very top, an observation deck would offer unrivaled views of Can Tho City and the sprawling delta beyond. This deck would be a prime spot for both locals and tourists to soak in the breathtaking scenery. By night, the tower would be lit up by eco-friendly LED lights, designed to reflect the vibrant energy of Can Tho and serve as a beacon of innovation and culture in the heart of the Mekong Delta.

Question: Tourism activities are monotonous and repetitive
Answer:
In 2023, Can Tho tourism welcomed nearly 5,99 million visitors, an increase of 17% over the same period in 2022; Total tourism revenue reached 5.420 billion VND. These numbers show that Can Tho is still a destination attracting many domestic and foreign tourists.

However, sharing with Lao Dong Newspaper, many tourists expressed their regret that their stay in Can Tho was not long, because the tourist activities here are quite monotonous, repetitive, and lacking in activities. Unique moves to retain.

Photo: Ta Quang
River tourism in Can Tho has not yet fully exploited its strengths. Photo: Ta Quang
During a year-end trip with her family, Ms. Do Thi Huong (52 years old, tourist from Hanoi) said that her family planned to stay in Can Tho for 3 days to explore the river features of the city. West, but just after the second day, family members were no longer as excited as at first.

“We visited Cai Rang floating market and a few famous tourist attractions. However, the floating market this time is no longer bustling, and the ecotourism destinations are almost the same, just familiar entertainment services, then going to fruit gardens or rowing boats, canoes... so just One day's experience is enough," Ms. Huong said.

Ms. Huong believes that if Can Tho has more outstanding, specialized and attractive tourism products, her family and many other tourists will extend their stay here.

As for Mr. Le Tuan Anh (33 years old, tourist from Dong Nai), Can Tho in his eyes is a peaceful land and he especially loves the generosity and hospitality of the people here. However, there are still things that make him regret.

“Every year I take time to return to Can Tho a few times to relax and rest. It can be said that among the attractions, I am impressed with the Con Son tourist area and have many times intended to stay longer, but one regret is that I could not find any accommodation services here, so So even if I want to stay, I can't," Mr. Tuan Anh said.

Innovated, improved quality but not really attractive

Currently, garden and river ecotourism are the main types of tourism that make Can Tho attractive in particular and the Mekong Delta region in general. This is also a unique resource that not every region has.

On the contrary, this is also a limitation when many gardeners exploit the common nuances of available natural resources such as rivers and gardens, lacking long-term investment, thereby creating duplication of resources. tourism products, unintentionally reducing the attraction for visitors.

Garden and river ecotourism are the main types of tourism. Photo: Yen Phuong
Garden and river ecotourism... are the main types of tourism. Photo: Yen Phuong
On the other hand, ecotourism is also affected by climate change and seasons. Many tourists have to endure the situation of spending money to visit gardens that only have leaves and branches, because they accidentally travel during the off-season.

Mr. Nguyen Nhat Khoa (28 years old, An Giang province) recounted that when he once brought his friends from Ho Chi Minh City to Can Tho, because he did not clearly understand the characteristics of fruits, he and his friends chose at the wrong time, then had to sadly endure the situation of visiting an empty garden, being sunny, losing money and getting nothing.

According to the assessment of the Steering Committee for Tourism Development of Can Tho City, the number of visitors to the city in the past year has increased, tourism products have innovated and improved quality... but are not really attractive and have not made a difference. ; competitiveness is not high; Strengths have not yet been exploited and promoted, typically river tourism; Can Tho City has not built specific products to promote to tourists.

Question: The periodic theater reform program "Da Co Cam Thi"
Answer:
The periodic theater reform program "Da Co Cam Thi" 
On the evening of August 31, the Tay Do Theater (under the Department of Culture, Sports and Tourism of Can Tho City) organized a periodic reformed theater performance called "Da Co Cam Thi" I. The program performed by the artists of Tay Do Theater, performing excerpts of classical reforms such as "Tô Anh Nguyệt", "Thăng Long Knight" ... and the works of amateurs, gossip, neo-ancient charm ... A large audience came to the theater to watch and cheer for the artists.


Hong Quoc Khanh, director of the Tay Do Theater, said: "Da Thi Cam Thi" will be performed periodically on the last Saturday night of the month. In addition to the actors of Tay Do Theater, the program will have the participation of artists and actors from the Can Tho City College of Culture and Arts, the City Theater Association, Can Tho University, etc. , the program will perform for audiences free of charge from now to the end of the year; In the future, the ticket will be sold at the symbolic level to maintain the operation or it will be free if the sponsor is found. This is an effort of Tay Do Theater in creating entertainment spots for city people and tourists when coming to Can Tho; at the same time contribute to preserving and promoting the traditional arts.

On the evening of the last Saturday of the month, the audience can watch the show "Da Co Cam Thi" at Tay Do Theater (No. 105, Tran Hung Dao Street, Ninh Kieu District).

Question: ruc Lam Phuong Nam Buddhist Meditation Monastery
Answer:
Truc Lam Phuong Nam Buddhist Meditation Monastery is located in My Khanh Commune, Phong Dien District, Can Tho City. This is the largest monastery in the Southwest region.

The monastery was started construction in 2013 (year of the Snake), on an area of ​​38,016 m². After many months of construction, the monastery was inaugurated in 2014 (year of the Horse).

The main hall is a combination of Tran Dynasty and Ly Dynasty. The bell weighs 1.5 tons are made in the style of Keo pagoda bell tower in Thai Binh province. Notably, the wood in these categories is imported ironwood from South Africa.

Inside the main hall, in the middle is a 3,5 ton bronze statue of Sakyamuni Buddha, carved in a sitting posture and a handle of a lotus flower (symbols for the pure and enlightenment); on the two sides are the Samantabhadra Bodhisattva statue (he is sitting on a white elephant with 6 ivories symbols for wisdom and compassion) and Manjushri Bodhisattva (he is sitting on a green lions symbols for the wisdom and holding a sword symbols for cutting off the painful thinking) . Inside the campus is the statue of Bo De Dat Ma Grand Master and 3 Truc Lam Grand Masters. In addition to the statue of Shakyamuni Buddha, which is cast in bronze, the other statues here are carved with a kind of pine wood (called limestone pine wood) with the age of 800 years.

The Truc Lam Yen Tu monastery of the Buddha Tran Nhan Tong in Tran Dynasty (1225-1400 with 14 reigns, he is the 3rth reign) - the king led Vietnamese against the Mongol invasion. When the country was peaceful, in 1299, the king left his throne to his son and went alone to Yen Tu Mountain to practice the Buddhism phylosophy and founded the Truc Lam Yen Tu Buddhism Meditation branch, creating an unity in belief of people.

In addition, the campus also has other items such as Quan Am temple, Di Lac Temple, One Pillar Pagoda, Library, Medicine Department, etc.

Question: Cultural Historical Vestige Can Tho Coverd Market
Answer:
Long time ago, all activities of the Mekong River Delta residents were arranged on rivers, merchants  used confluence of the rivers in the region as a meeting place for getting together and  trading, which led to the establishment of markets and towns. Can Tho Covered Market was not an exception. It has existed for nearly a hundred years and become a symbol of CanTho city. This place does not only show the value of culture and history but also the soul of Can tho City. Its existence proves the process of development of this region.

Under the dynasty of Minh Mang King in 1839, Can Tho had some unplanned markets, “...Suu-near the Can Tho Pier, and Tan An- lying in the same direction as Binh Thuy River...,”[1]. These markets worked rather actively. At the end of the 19th century and beginning of the 20th century, after the French colonialists occupied Nam Ky Luc Tinh and established Can Tho province, they built some administrative units – provincial committees, banks – a resort on Bassac Confluence (Hau River), parks, and docks...(2). They also built covered markets near these places. Can Tho was one of the biggest trading markets in the west of  the South of Viet Nam  and the main market of Can Tho.

Since Can Tho Covered Market was established by the French rule, other commercial buildings here were mushroomed, which boosted the economy of the area and other neighboring provinces and Can Tho market became a Dau Moi market (selling things in large quantities)- the most important one in Nam Ky Luc Tinh (the name of the South of Viet Nam under the Nguyen Dynasty). For this reason, it carried the name “Luc Tinh”. It also had another name called Hang Duong due to the fact that it was next to a park in which lots of pine trees were planted. Although it has many names, the word Can Tho is rooted in the mind of the Can Tho locals, especially the old and Vietnamese expatriates.

 The position of Can Tho Covered Market is unchanged through up and down of history. The entrance faces Hai Ba Trung street. Its side part is across the park and a block of commercial buildings. Its back faces Hau River. This location facilitates services and trades both “by land and by water”. The area of this place is designed in a T-shape with an area of 1,723sqm. It is mainly made of concrete and steel, and the roof is covered with tiles. This type of architecture is a combination of classic and modern styles, which creates a market with a high and firm structure. The main hall of the market has three towers. The tower in the middle is the biggest one. On its two sides are two smaller towers decorated with designs and louvers, which creates a clear space. The top of the tower is particularly decorated with images of fire orbs and stylized dragons and clouds. A clock is attached to the side of the tower, so it is called a clock tower. Although the size of Can Tho market without walls is not so big as Dong Ba Market in Hue, Binh Tay Market and Ben Thanh Market in Ho Chi Minh City, which were built in the early twentieth century by a French building contractor named Brossard et Mupin, its structure is neat, beautiful, and delicat. A combination between Eastern and Western styles of architecture is expressed through materials, colors, and lines, which enhances the beauty of the market and emphasized cultural aspects of the land full of rivers and canals. Especially, the harmonious combination in space and architecture between the markets, streets, and parks with green trees in the front has remained intact up to now. Therefore, Can Tho Market was once recognized as a beautiful market in Nam Ky Luc Tinh.

Can Tho Market has been active for more than 100 hundred years and has fulfilled its historical role as a leading market in trade in Nam Ky Luc Tinh since the early twentieth century. When Can Tho was officially recognized as a centrally- governed city(3), Can Tho Market continued to fulfil its role as a “whole sum” market, making positive contributions to the development of economy, trade, and services for Can Tho and the provinces in the Mekong Delta.  Can Tho Covered Market was deteriorated due to long existence and has been repaired  many times, which changes some features of the original architecture, but in general, its shape remains unchanged. In order to preserve the original architecture of Can Tho Market and continue to maximize the strengths of the traditional market, develop economy, promote trade, and expand services, in 2005, the City People’s Committee had Can Tho Trade Company (CTC) invested in repairing and bringing Can Tho Covered Market back to its original state and simultaneously using it as a cultural site, trading center, and tourist attraction. The construction was inaugurated on April 30, 2005-  to commemorate the 30th Anniversary of the  Liberation Day (April 30th, 1975 – April 30th, 2005).

 At present, this covered market has about 80 kiosks selling souvenirs, traditional handicraft products, garments and typical products of the South of Vietnam. Besides, after doing some shopping, tourists and travelers can stop by the Sao Mai restaurant to enjoy some European and Asian dishes and look at the beauty of gentle Hau River.

 Since 2009, Can Tho city has had some traditional and cultural activities related to tourism development at Ninh Kieu Quay. Other ones like street foods, “Tay Do Night Market”, street entertainers come to life on weekends along Hai Ba Trung street and in front of the commercial buildings near Can Tho Covered Market, which attracts more domestic and international tours to Can Tho City. These activities also make the area more active and lively.

Can Tho Covered Market is another tourist attraction of Can Tho city. This is a place where travellers and tourists can not only enjoy the beauty of architecture but also experience the lifestyle and activities of the people in the Mekong River Delta depicted in the market. This market still preserves the value of history, culture, and architecture associated with the formation and development of CanTho and becomes a typical feature of the Mekong River Delta. Since Can Tho covered market had those values, after launching a contest in designing a symbol for Can Tho city in 2010, Can Tho City People’s Committee chose and decided to publicly introduce the design in which an image of the stylized covered market locating by the side of the Mekong river was the symbol of Can Tho. At the same time, in 2012, Can Tho City People’s Committee issued a decision to recognize Can Tho Covered Market as a historical and cultural heritage(4).

In the future, Can Tho Covered Market is expected to be  an ideal site to hold cultural and cuisine events  and improve the sights in the wharf and on the boats which are considered a cultural feature of the land full of rivers and canals. These are also positive ways to preserve the heritage, maximize the strengths of the traditional market, and change it into a trading center and tourist attraction in the present situation.

Question: Meditation Centre PTN Global
Answer: The area Ninh Kieu, Can Tho 92000 Vietnam
